concise_definition: v. 重考, 重拍, 重新取得

definitions.explanation_en: To take a test, exam, or assessment again, usually because the first attempt was unsuccessful or unsatisfactory.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因首次尝试未通过或不理想而重新参加考试或评估。
definitions.example_en: She failed the driving test the first time, so she plans to retake it next week.
definitions.example_cn: 她第一次驾照考试没通过，所以计划下周重考。

definitions.explanation_en: To film or record a scene again, typically because of an error or unsatisfactory performance during the first attempt.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因首次拍摄出现错误或表现不佳而重新拍摄一个镜头或场景。
definitions.example_en: The director asked the actors to retake the scene after the camera malfunctioned.
definitions.example_cn: 导演因摄像机故障，要求演员们重拍这一幕。

definitions.explanation_en: To regain possession or control of something that was previously lost or taken away.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指重新获得之前失去或被夺走的物品、权利或控制权。
definitions.example_en: The army managed to retake the city after a fierce battle.
definitions.example_cn: 经过一场激战，军队成功夺回了这座城市。

comparison.analysis: “Retest” 专指重新进行测试或检验，语义范围较窄，主要用于学术、医疗或技术评估场景。而 “retake” 除了用于考试，还可用于影视拍摄或军事行动，语义更广。
“Replay” (重播/重演) 通常指重复播放已录制的内容（如视频、音频）或在体育比赛中重复某个动作，强调的是“再现”而非“重新完成”。而 “retake” 强调的是主动、有目的的重新执行，通常是为了改进或修正。
“Recapture” (重新捕获/夺回) 与 “retake” 在军事或物理夺取语境中相近，但 “recapture” 更常用于捕捉人或动物（如逃犯、野生动物），而 “retake” 更广泛用于城市、阵地、控制权等抽象或地理对象的重新掌控。
